verses.text: 保羅、西拉和提摩太，寫信給帖撒羅尼迦、在父 神和主耶穌基督裡的教會。願恩惠平安臨到你們。

words.note: Ancient city in Macedonia, target of Paul's letters.
Here refers to God the Father.
The blank space before 神 is a common reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to Jesus Christ.
Often used with 在 (zài) to mean 'in'.
A common greeting and biblical concept.

verses.heading: Salutation

verses.text: 我們常常為你們眾人感謝 神，禱告的時候提到你們，

words.note: A verb-object compound meaning 'to pray'.
Connects a preceding clause/phrase to a noun, forming a descriptive unit.

verses.heading: Thanksgiving for Response to the Gospel

verses.text: 在我們的父 神面前，不住地記念你們信心的工作，愛心的勞苦和因盼望我們主耶穌基督而有的堅忍。

words.note: Literally 'not stop-ly'.
Can also be a verb: to hope.
Connects cause/manner to effect/result.

verses.text: 神所愛的弟兄們，我們知道你們是蒙揀選的，

words.note: Used before verbs to form a passive or nominalized structure.
A common term for fellow believers in Christian contexts.
Often used in passive constructions, meaning 'to be favored with' or 'to receive'.
Here, it nominalizes '蒙揀選', meaning 'the chosen ones'.

verses.text: 因為我們的福音傳到你們那裡，不單是藉著言語，也是藉著權能，藉著聖靈和充足的信心。為了你們的緣故，我們在你們中間為人怎樣，這是你們知道的。

words.note: Literally 'blessed sound' or 'news of blessing'.
Here emphasizes a known fact or creates a nominalized phrase.

verses.text: 你們效法了我們，也效法了主，在大患難中，帶著聖靈的喜樂接受了真道。

words.note: Refers to the truth or the gospel.

verses.text: 這樣，你們就成了馬其頓和亞該亞所有信徒的榜樣。
因為不單主的道從你們那裡傳遍了馬其頓和亞該亞，就是你們對 神的信心也傳遍了各處，所以我們不用再說甚麼了。

words.note: Refers to the gospel or message of the Lord.
Refers to 'from among you' or 'from your place'.
Used for emphasis, meaning 'even your faith'.

verses.text: 他們都述說你們是怎樣接待我們，而且怎樣離棄偶像歸向 神，要服事這位又真又活的 神，
並且等候他的兒子從天降臨。這就是 神使他從死人中復活，救我們脫離將來的忿怒的那位耶穌。

words.note: Refers to the divine realm or sky.
Often used for divine or royal आगमन.
Often refers to divine wrath in biblical context.
